I have recently been working on a bot for my private MQTT broker that pretends to be an actual device on the network. While experimenting with this, I noticed that sending a NodeInfo packet with a HardwareModel that was added in version 2.6 of the protobufs will cause the Android app to crash when trying to view "More Details" on that node.

I originally tested this by broadcasting the April Fools RESERVED_FRIED_CHICKEN hardware model (because I was curious what would happen), but the crash also happens with hardware models added after MESH_TAB.

While it's perfectly understandable that it wouldn't know what to do with a bucket of fried chicken, the app really shouldn't crash if you happen to come across a recently released device in the wild and try to view more info on it.

If you have battery optimization enabled and Trail Sense is completely closed, trying to start any of the services from the quick tiles fails due to Android's background restrictions.

Maybe clicking the tile needs to open Trail Sense to enable it? That doesn't sound like a great solution though - there must be another option (I'm very surprised this isn't one of the allowed foreground service entry points - I may open a bug with Android on that).

Or it can use the can't start background services notification when the foreground service fails to post (same as the background location restriction on Android 14).

This may also be a problem only on Android 14 - need to do more investigation.
